Description:
Ballistics of the 3UBK2 100x910mmR HEAT-FS round with the 3BK3 projectile, of steel liner construction, fired from the T-12 and MT-12 anti-tank guns. Variant includes the 3UBK2M round with the 3BK3M projectile, of copper liner construction. These rounds entered service in 1961, and was equipped with the GPV-2 piezoelectric-spitback fuze.

Loads 4.9 kg of 13/1 DG-3 grains. Tabulated velocity is 975 m/s from 2,200 kgf/cm² breech pressure, converted from copper crusher gauge with a factor of 1.12 x 0.9806. Projectile travel estimated from a gun length of 6300 mm (63 calibers), chamber length 915 mm.

References:
- 100-мм ПРОТИВОТАНКОВАЯ ПУШКА MT-12 РУКОВОДСТВО СЛУЖБЫ (1980)
- артиллерийские метательные заряды (Г.Г. Валеев, В.Ф. Сопин, Б.А. Соков, 2004)
